text.master-channel-fixed-by-wisp-2: Determined by a 2.4 GHz Wireless ISP connection
text.master-channel-fixed-by-wisp-5: Determined by a 5 GHz Wireless ISP connection
text.no-free-access-points: Maximum number of wireless networks assigned. To assign further wireless networks please disable an existing wireless network in another segment.
text.access-points-settings-are-equal: The name, security settings, and schedule of the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz networks are the same.

button.bind-access-point: Bind a wireless network to a segment

confirm.unbind-access-point: The wireless network will be removed from the segment

roaming-section.description: Allows mobile clients to roam more seamlessly between access points within a single network segment.
roaming-section.hint: This section allows to configure 802.11k/r/v options. For those options to work add at least one wireless network to the segment. Fast transition (802.11r) will work only for unsecured and WPA2-PSK protected networks. For dual-band devices it is required to set the same SSID, passkey & schedule for both wireless networks to enable 802.11r.

ft-mode.label: Fast transition (802.11r)
ft-mode.hint: To enable fast transition for both 2.4 & 5 GHz wireless networks the names & security settings of 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Wi-Fi networks must be the same.

options.enabled-on-wifi2: Enabled for 2.4 GHz wireless network only
options.enabled-on-wifi5: Enabled for 5 GHz wireless network only
options.enabled-on-both: Enabled for both 2.4 & 5 GHz wireless networks

mobility-domain-id.label: Mobility domain ID
mobility-domain-id.description: Defines a group of access points in this segment, which will provide the fast roaming feature.

hide-ssid.label: Hide SSID
hide-ssid.description: The network will not appear in the list of available networks on user devices

enable-wmm.label: Enable WMM
enable-wmm.description: For best performance of audio, video, and voice over Wi-Fi

band-steering.label: Band Steering
band-steering.tooltip: Band Steering is a technology that detects whether or not the wireless client is dual-band capable, and if it is, it will push the client to connect to the less congested 5 GHz network. Based on the signal level Keenetic will calculate the optimal band for every dual-band wireless client in real time and switch them back-and-forth between 2.4 & 5 GHz networks
band-steering.bottom-description: The names & security settings of the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Wi-Fi networks must be the same

enable-tx-burst.label: TX Burst
enable-tx-burst.tooltip: Use TX Burst feature to increase the peak data transfer rate from the Keenetic to 802.11 n/ac clients. It always works in home network, but if your ISP's hardware is not compatible with this mode, the Internet speed for Wi-Fi-enabled devices may drop.

256-qam.label: 256-QAM
256-qam.tooltip: Increases connection speed to devices that use 256-QAM modulation in the 2.4 GHz band.

beamforming.label: Beamforming
beamforming.tooltip:
Beamforming technology improves the quality of wireless communication by individually adjusting the transmitted signal for each client.
The checkbox enables the explicit Beamforming mode that formats a multipath Wi-Fi signal based on the feedback from wireless clients.

mu-mimo.label: MU-MIMO
mu-mimo.tooltip: Increases the performance of a wireless network in the corresponding band by simultaneously transmitting data to several wireless clients.

validation-error.not-unique-ssid: This name is already in use
